intro: Dimeria eradii, commonly known as the red-stemmed dimeria, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. Dimeria eradii is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its thick stems and leaves. Its growth habit is usually low and spreading, making it a hardy ground cover plant.
